**Solution**

$[\vec{x}^*\vec{b} - 1.96\, \SE_{\mathrm{pred}}, \vect{x}^*\vec{b} + 1.96\, \SE_{\mathrm{pred}}]$, where $\SE_{\mathrm{pred}} = s\sqrt{1 +\vec{x^*}(\mathbb{X}^T\mat{X})^{-1}\vec{x^{*T}}}$. $\vec{x^*}$ is the new observed value and $\mat{X}$ is the design matrix. s is an approximation of $\sigma$, the standard deviation of the errors.
